thread.title: Greentopia event focuses on sustainable communities
thread.title_full: Greentopia event focuses on sustainable communities

title: Greentopia event focuses on sustainable communities
text:
Greentopia event focuses on sustainable communities   
A group of leaders in sustainability and the future of cities gathered Wednesday for the 2015 Futures Summit, an event at Monroe Community College that discusses building sustainable communities. The event is a partnership between MCC and Friends of the GardenAerial, and organization known locally as Greentopia that promotes preservation and sustainability. Speakers include Robert Duffy, president of the Rochester Business Alliance; Svante Myrick, Ithaca mayor; Heidi Zimmer-Meyer, president of the Rochester Downtown Development Corp.; and M. Andre Primus, founder and director of RocShare. The event includes keynote speakers and eight panel discussions and workshop, put on by local leaders working toward creating sustainable change. The event ran 7:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. on the MCC Brighton campus.
